smell_analysis.justification: The diagram titled 'Autode register (Töötaja)' on page 13 appears to contain only the diagram title with no visible classes/tables or other elements, indicating an empty diagram.

On the use case diagrams on pages 2 and 3, no use case is explicitly shown as lacking association with all actors. The text lists on the package/overview page 1 are not treated as use cases per the rule note.

Across the use case diagrams on pages 2 and 3, no two or more use cases clearly describe the same activity with the same actor (for example, names like 'Registreeri auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', and the various 'Vaata ...' cases are distinct).

On the package diagram on page 1, there is no clear, explicit duplication of model element primary names within the same package. Repeated classifier-type or membership-style annotations elsewhere are treated as metadata and do not indicate duplicates.

The database-style diagrams on pages 15-20 show standard PK/FK structures and do not explicitly show two or more tables storing redundant copies of the same data value without a foreign key. Identically named common columns (for example, 'nimetus') are not treated as redundancy.
Use case names on pages 2 and 3 appear consistent in form, starting with verbs such as 'Tuvasta', 'Vaata', 'Registreeri', 'Lõpeta', 'Muuda', 'Aktiveeri', and 'Unusta'.
In the state diagram 'Auto seisundidiagramm' on page 9, no state is explicitly shown as unreachable based on the visible states and transitions; an unreachable state is not unambiguously indicated.

In the activity diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' on page 4, no action is explicitly shown as unreachable; the flow appears to connect actions and decision points without a clear isolated action.

Class diagrams on pages 5-8, 10-12, and 14 show multiplicity indicators where visible (for example, '1', '0..*', '0..1'). The database diagrams on pages 15-20 use FK-style notation that is exempt under the interpretation rules, so no clear UML-style relationship lacking multiplicities at both ends is explicitly shown.

No single diagram clearly shows 10 or more central elements. For example, the use case diagrams on pages 2 and 3 appear to show fewer than 10 use cases each, the state diagram on page 9 shows fewer than 10 states, and the database classifier diagram on page 16 lists about nine tables.

No single class/table is explicitly shown with 6 or more distinct visible relationship lines on any specific class or database diagram. The presence of multiple FK annotations in the text does not unambiguously confirm 6+ separately drawn relationship lines.

The PDF content does not provide an explicit, unambiguous visual indication that any related pair of elements is placed at a distance more than twice the average distance between elements on the same diagram.

Use case names on pages 2 and 3 start with active verbs (for example, 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda', 'Aktiveeri'). Activity actions visible on page 4 also appear verb-initial (for example, 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali', 'Lõpeta').

No class, table, attribute/column, or use case name is clearly 3 or fewer characters long. Names such as 'Isik', 'Auto', and 'Riik' are longer than three characters, and column names like 'isik_id' or 'auto_kood' exceed this threshold.
Class names visible in the conceptual class diagrams (for example, 'Isik', 'Töötaja', 'Auto', 'Kasutajakonto', 'Klassifikaator') start with uppercase letters and are not clearly plural.

Attribute/column names shown in both conceptual class diagrams and database-style diagrams appear to start with lowercase letters (for example, 'e_meil', 'eesnimi', 'nimetus', 'auto_kood', 'isikukood').

Database table names visible on pages 15-20 (for example, 'Auto', 'Klient', 'Riik', 'Auto_mark', 'Auto_kategooria') are not clearly plural. Any plural-sounding register labels appear to be diagram or register context rather than individual entity table names.

No class, table, attribute, or use case name is explicitly shown with a disallowed type-indicating prefix such as 'tbl_', 'uc_', or 'str'. Allowed PK/FK-related markers appear as constraints/annotations rather than disallowed naming prefixes.
